datalib packageÔÉÅ

SubmodulesÔÉÅ

datalib.analysis moduleÔÉÅ

Functions for regression and data analysis.

datalib.analysis.linear_regression(X, y, return_metrics=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Perform linear regression.

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • y ‚Äì Target vector.

  • return_metrics ‚Äì If True, return model metrics (default: False).

datalib.analysis.multiple_linear_regression(X, y, return_metrics=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Perform multiple linear regression.

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • y ‚Äì Target vector.

  • return_metrics ‚Äì If True, return model metrics (default: False).

datalib.analysis.polynomial_regression(X, y, degree, return_metrics=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Perform polynomial regression.

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • y ‚Äì Target vector.

  • degree ‚Äì Polynomial degree.

  • return_metrics ‚Äì If True, return model metrics (default: False).

datalib.data_processing moduleÔÉÅ

Functions for data loading, cleaning, and preprocessing.

datalib.data_processing.encode_categorical(df, column)[source]ÔÉÅ

Encode a categorical column as integers.

Parameters:

  • df ‚Äì DataFrame containing the data.

  • column ‚Äì Column to encode.

datalib.data_processing.fill_missing_values(df, column, method='mean')[source]ÔÉÅ

Fill missing values in a column.

Parameters:

  • df ‚Äì DataFrame containing the data.

  • column ‚Äì Column to fill.

  • method ‚Äì Method to fill values (‚Äúmean‚Äù, ‚Äúmedian‚Äù, ‚Äúmode‚Äù).

datalib.data_processing.load_csv(file_path)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load a CSV file into a DataFrame.

Parameters:

file_path (str) ‚Äì Path to the CSV file.

datalib.data_processing.normalize_column(df, column)[source]ÔÉÅ

Normalize a column in the DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • df ‚Äì DataFrame containing the data.

  • column ‚Äì Column to normalize.

datalib.data_processing.scale_data(df, columns)[source]ÔÉÅ

Scale numerical columns.

Parameters:

  • df ‚Äì DataFrame containing the data.

  • columns ‚Äì List of columns to scale.

datalib.reinforcement moduleÔÉÅ

Functions for reinforcement learning algorithms.

datalib.reinforcement.basic_q_learning(environment, episodes, alpha, gamma, epsilon=0.1)[source]ÔÉÅ

Implement the Q-learning algorithm.

Parameters:

  • environment ‚Äì The RL environment.

  • episodes ‚Äì Number of episodes to train.

  • alpha ‚Äì Learning rate.

  • gamma ‚Äì Discount factor.

  • epsilon ‚Äì Exploration rate.

datalib.reinforcement.sarsa(environment, episodes, alpha, gamma, epsilon=0.1)[source]ÔÉÅ

Implement the SARSA algorithm.

Parameters:

  • environment ‚Äì The RL environment.

  • episodes ‚Äì Number of episodes to train.

  • alpha ‚Äì Learning rate.

  • gamma ‚Äì Discount factor.

  • epsilon ‚Äì Exploration rate.

Functions for performing statistical analysis.

data ‚Äì Array-like dataset.

Calculate the mode of a dataset.

data ‚Äì Array-like dataset.

Calculate the Pearson correlation coefficient.

Parameters:

  • x ‚Äì First dataset.

  • y ‚Äì Second dataset.

datalib.statistics.calculate_spearman_correlation(x, y)[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculate the Spearman rank correlation coefficient.

Parameters:

  • x ‚Äì First dataset.

  • y ‚Äì Second dataset.

datalib.statistics.perform_chi_square_test(table)[source]ÔÉÅ

Perform a chi-square test.

Parameters:

table ‚Äì Contingency table for the test.

datalib.statistics.perform_t_test(data1, data2, alternative='two-sided')[source]ÔÉÅ

Perform a t-test.

Parameters:

  • data1 ‚Äì First dataset.

  • data2 ‚Äì Second dataset.

  • alternative ‚Äì Type of test (‚Äútwo-sided‚Äù, ‚Äúgreater‚Äù, ‚Äúless‚Äù).

datalib.supervised moduleÔÉÅ

Functions for supervised machine learning models.

datalib.supervised.train_decision_tree(X, y, max_depth=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Train a Decision Tree classifier.

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • y ‚Äì Target vector.

  • max_depth ‚Äì Maximum depth of the tree.

datalib.supervised.train_knn(X, y, n_neighbors=5, weights='uniform')[source]ÔÉÅ

Train a k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN) classifier.

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • y ‚Äì Target vector.

  • n_neighbors ‚Äì Number of neighbors (default: 5).

  • weights ‚Äì Weight function (‚Äúuniform‚Äù or ‚Äúdistance‚Äù).

datalib.supervised.train_random_forest(X, y, n_estimators=100)[source]ÔÉÅ

Train a Random Forest classifier.

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • y ‚Äì Target vector.

  • n_estimators ‚Äì Number of trees in the forest (default: 100).

Functions for unsupervised learning algorithms.

Perform Gaussian Mixture Modeling.

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • n_components ‚Äì Number of mixture components.

datalib.unsupervised.perform_kmeans(X, n_clusters, random_state=42)[source]ÔÉÅ

Perform k-means clustering.

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • n_clusters ‚Äì Number of clusters.

  • random_state ‚Äì Random seed.

datalib.unsupervised.perform_pca(X, n_components)[source]ÔÉÅ

Perform Principal Component Analysis (PCA).

Parameters:

  • X ‚Äì Feature matrix.

  • n_components ‚Äì Number of components to retain.

datalib.visualization moduleÔÉÅ

Functions for creating various data visualizations.

datalib.visualization.plot_bar(data, x, y, title='Bar Chart', color='blue')[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a bar plot.

Parameters:

  • data ‚Äì DataFrame containing the data.

  • x ‚Äì Column name for the x-axis.

  • y ‚Äì Column name for the y-axis.

  • title ‚Äì Title of the chart (default: ‚ÄúBar Chart‚Äù).

  • color ‚Äì Bar color (default: ‚Äúblue‚Äù).

datalib.visualization.plot_correlation_matrix(data, title='Correlation Matrix', cmap='coolwarm')[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a correlation matrix heatmap.

Parameters:

  • data ‚Äì DataFrame containing numerical data.

  • title ‚Äì Title of the heatmap (default: ‚ÄúCorrelation Matrix‚Äù).

  • cmap ‚Äì Colormap for the heatmap (default: ‚Äúcoolwarm‚Äù).

datalib.visualization.plot_histogram(data, column, bins=10, title='Histogram', color='green')[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a histogram.

Parameters:

  • data ‚Äì DataFrame containing the data.

  • column ‚Äì Column to plot.

  • bins ‚Äì Number of bins (default: 10).

  • title ‚Äì Title of the chart (default: ‚ÄúHistogram‚Äù).

  • color ‚Äì Bar color (default: ‚Äúgreen‚Äù).

datalib.visualization.plot_scatter(data, x, y, title='Scatter Plot', color='red')[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a scatter plot.

Parameters:

  • data ‚Äì DataFrame containing the data.

  • x ‚Äì Column name for the x-axis.

  • y ‚Äì Column name for the y-axis.

  • title ‚Äì Title of the chart (default: ‚ÄúScatter Plot‚Äù).

  • color ‚Äì Point color (default: ‚Äúred‚Äù).

Module contentsÔÉÅ

Initialize the datalib package.

This package includes various modules for data visualization, analysis, processing, statistical operations, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning.

Modules: - visualization: Functions for plotting and visualizations. - analysis: Functions for regression and analysis. - data_processing: Functions for loading, cleaning, and preprocessing data. - statistics: Functions for statistical analysis. - supervised: Functions for supervised machine learning models. - unsupervised: Functions for unsupervised learning methods. - reinforcement: Functions for reinforcement learning algorithms.
